chav1961.funnypro

Class FunnyProEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.script.AbstractScriptEngine
      • chav1961.funnypro.FunnyProEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFProVM, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, javax.script.ScriptEngine

    public class FunnyProEngine
extends javax.script.AbstractScriptEngine
implements java.io.Closeable, IFProVM

    This class implements engine for the Funny prolog interpreter. All requirements about it can be read in the AbstractScriptEngine description of the javax.script package. To get engine, use code:

    final ScriptEngineManager factory = new ScriptEngineManager();
    final FunnyPrologEngine engine = (FunnyPrologEngine)factory.getEngineByName("FunnyProlog");

    This engine implements the Closeable interface, so can be used in the try-with-resource statements.

    This engine contains a Funny Prolog virtual machine inside, named FProVM. Life cycle of FProVm is:

    1. IFProVM.turnOn(InputStream) - start VM and deserialize it's persistent database from the input stream
    2. Use IFProVM.consult(CharacterSource), IFProVM.save(CharacterTarget), IFProVM.console(Reader, Writer, Writer), IFProVM.goal(String, IFProEntitiesRepo, chav1961.funnypro.core.interfaces.IFProVM.IFProCallback) etc.
    3. IFProVM.turnOff(OutputStream) - stop VM and serialize it's persistent database to the output stream

    You also can create empty persistent database by calling IFProVM.newFRB(OutputStream). After getting this class by ScriptEngineManager.getEngineByName(String), the FProVM is turned on with the empty persistent database. Calling close() will turns off the FProVM.

    This class is not thread-safe.

    Since:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    javax.script, AbstractScriptEngine
